intro: Hieracium crispulifolium, commonly known as the curly-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has distinctive, hairy, and often curled leaves, which give it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often found in meadows and disturbed soils. Hieracium crispulifolium is a perennial species that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
